page.title: 17WORK OF PARISH COUNCIL (2)
page.content: The mining, at Gamblethorpe and Astley causes noise, dust and vibrations in nearby houses due to blasting. There has also been a growth in the number of heavy lorries on local roads. Once coal extraction is complete the land on one site will be restored to provide leisure park with lakes, a nature reserve and other facilities for the public to enjoy. The other site is to be used for the disposal of refuse. There is a children's play- ground adjacent to the Miners Welfare ground with swings, slides, etc. unfortunately these are often being vandalised. Children living on the north side of the busy main road do not have a play area of their own due to the lack of a suitable site.However it is hoped to build a B.M.X.track in the near future for local school children and teenagers.
